title: Norms are more toxic than ranked, change my mind.
body:
Always hear about how ranked is super toxic and norms is chill from people but I've experienced more chill players in ranked than in norms.


Always get the edgy "i'm the best and it's my team holding me down, better talk shit to every single one of them" players who go off in chat in norms.

replies.body:
1) Probably confirmation bias. Looking at your match history, you play 95% Normal matches, so you're more exposed to behavior in Normals than Ranked.

2) I have played 2 Normals in the last 3 years. What's the point? It's like, PVP video games for people who aren't trying to win.
It isn't my job to change your mind. You are entitled to your opinuon on the matter. Just like I am entitled to my opinion that a rhinoceros is simply a fat unicorn.

I personally don't play ranked that often but from my few experiences of ranked people are always on edge. Even if you can step away and think "Oh it's just a game" ranked applies a lot of stress and a lot of people take it out on others in the game. Sure normals can be just as toxic if someone is having a bad day or someone takes them as seriously as ranked but I'd expect more consistent stress and toxicity from a ranked environment.

Though all of my evidence here is anecdotal. I would actually be fairly interested in seeing which queues have the highest punishment rates in them if they even keep track of that.
People in Normals don't even try, though. There is no objective priority or strategy. These "edgy" people are probably the ones that care the most and get angry when their teammates don't.

I would've said no, you're incorrect prior, but it seems that I've just been chat banned from a single normal game. The last line of text in the chat ban is me asking the person who's harassing me (and trying to friend me afterwards to continue the harassment) to "please stop." Fun times /s

I hope the devs put more effort into vs bots rewards such as borders, missions, etc. It's the only nice place to play it seems :(
